In October, Sergio Marchionne ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Trade unions and politicians accused him of "blackmail" in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure.
